description: The unique identification number for each animal.
The unique identification number for each shelter or rescue.
Species of animal.
The primary (assumed) breed assigned by the shelter or rescue.
The secondary (assumed) breed assigned by the shelter or rescue.
Whether or not an animal is presumed to be mixed breed.
Whether or not the animal's breed is completely unknown.
The most prevalent color of an animal.
The second most prevalent color of an animal.
The third most prevalent color of an animal.
The assumed age class of an animal (Baby,ÿYoung,ÿAdult, orÿSenior).
The sex of an animal (Female,ÿMale, orÿUnknown).
The general size class of an animal (Small,ÿMedium,ÿLarge,ÿExtra Large).
Coat Length for each animal (Curly,ÿHairless,ÿLong,ÿMedium,ÿShort,ÿWire).
Whether or not an animal has been spayed/neutered.
Whether or not an animal is trained to not go to the bathroom in the house.
Whether or not the animal has had its dewclaws removed.
Whether or not the animal is considered to have special needs (this can be a long-term medical condition or particular temperament that requires extra care).
Whether or not the animal is up to date on all of their vaccines and other shots.
Whether or not the animal is recommended for a home with children.
Whether or not the animal is recommended for a home with other dogs.
Whether or not the animal is recommended for a home with cats.
The animal?s name (as given by the shelter/rescue).
Any tags given to the dog by the shelter rescue (pipeÿ|ÿseparated).
The URL to the animal?s primary photo.
Whether the animal isÿadoptableÿor not.
The date that this animal was first listed on a local website .
The rescue/shelter?s listed city.
The rescue/shelter?s listed state.
The rescue/shelter?s listed zip code.
The rescue/shelter?s listed country.
The state abbreviation queried in the API to return this result .
The date that this data was acquired from the PetFinder API.
The type of animal.
The full description of an animal, as entered by the rescue or shelter. This is the only field returned by the V1 API.
